app.py:
Page Title: app.py

Module Overview:

  Purpose: This module initializes a Flask application and defines two routes for handling HTTP requests.

  Dependencies: 
  - Flask: The Flask framework for building web applications.

Functions:

  hello_world() -> str:
  - Purpose: Returns a simple "Hello, World!" message.
  - Arguments: None
  - Returns: str
  - Exceptions: None

  ping() -> str:
  - Purpose: Returns a "pong" message.
  - Arguments: None
  - Returns: str
  - Exceptions: None
views.py:
Page Title: placeholder_views.py

Module Overview:

  Purpose: This module contains placeholder views for the application, serving as templates for future development and integration of actual views.

  Dependencies: 
  - django: The web framework used for building the application.
  - templates: HTML templates for rendering the views.

Classes:

  No classes defined in this module.

Functions:

  placeholder_view1() -> None:
  - Purpose: A placeholder function for a view that will display a list of items.
  - Arguments: None
  - Returns: None
  - Exceptions: None

  placeholder_view2(item_id: int) -> str:
  - Purpose: A placeholder function for a view that will display details of a specific item.
  - Arguments:
    - item_id (int): The unique identifier of the item to display.
  - Returns: A string containing the details of the item.
  - Exceptions: None

  placeholder_view3() -> None:
  - Purpose: A placeholder function for a view that will handle user authentication.
  - Arguments: None
  - Returns: None
  - Exceptions: None
